thread.title: Peyton Manning, Broncos hang on to beat Browns in overtime
thread.title_full: Peyton Manning, Broncos hang on to beat Browns in overtime - The Denver Post

author: Troy E. Renck
title: Peyton Manning, Broncos hang on to beat Browns in overtime
text:
CLEVELAND â€” The Broncos earned the benefit of doubt. They were a perfect team, making their blemishes easy to overlook.
They were again afforded such a courtesy after a 26-23 overtime victory over the Cleveland Browns on Sunday.
Before trying to talk through how this happened, let's start with an observation. The Broncos somehow, someway remain 6-0. It's the seventh time they've accomplished this feat. Five of the previous times they advanced to the Super Bowl.
Brandon McManus finally missed a field goal this season, but not the finisher. He finished off the Browns with a 34-yard field goal.
The Broncos possess a championship defense, but an offense that continues to create questions.
Peyton Manning continues to make mistakes that compromise the defense. None has bad as his toss into linebacker Barkevious Mingo's hands on Denver's first possession in overtime. Mingo feigned a blitz and dropped back, easily snaring a pass intended for Demaryius Thomas, who made overtime necessary with a critical fourth quarter drop.
Cleveland took over at its own 40-yard line needing a field goal to win. The Browns lost 18 yards. The Broncos produced back-to-back sacks, including a crush smash by Malik Jackson.
Josh McCown marched Cleveland from the 40-yard line in the fourth quarter to tie the score, aided by a foolish roughing the passer penalty on Derek Wolfe. Denver stiffened as the Browns grew conservative once they reached the 11-yard line. On third down, safety T.J. Ward blitz, causing McCown to scramble and throw incomplete, leading to Travis Coon's field goal, making it 23-23.
